text: Lodève () is a commune in the Hérault département in the Occitanie region in southern France. It is a subprefecture of the department and also the capital of the arrondissement of the same name. ==History== Lodève started as the capital of a Celtic tribe before becoming the Roman city Luteva (also known as Forum Neronis). It was a centre for textile production under Louis XV and was home to one of only two royal factories for tapestry, the other being the one in Paris. ==Geography== Lodève is in the north of the Hérault department, where the plains rise up to the Larzac plateau. It is a narrow valley of the Lergue river, a tributary of the Hérault river. The commune has an area of and is at an altitude of about above sea level. The city of Montpellier is to the east of Lodève at and Béziers is to the west at . Lodève is at from the Mediterranean Sea. The commune of Lodève is surrounded by the communes Soumont, Olmet-et-Villecun, Poujols, Fozières, Les Plans, Le Puech, Soubès, Lauroux, Lavalette, Saint-Étienne-de-Gourgas, Le Bosc and Usclas-du-Bosc. Lodève and its neighboring communes ===Climate=== The climate of Lodève, in the Köppen climate classification, is Csb - Mediterranean climate with template summers. ==Population== The inhabitants of Lodève are known, in French, as Lodévois (women: Lodévoises). With a population of 7,381, Lodève has a population density of inhabitants/km2. It is part of the intercommunality Lodévois et Larzac (). === Sister cities === Lodève is twinned with: * South Kirkby and Moorthorpe, Wakefield, West Yorkshire, England, United Kingdom == Sites of interest == * Lodève Cathedral (Cathédrale Saint-Fulcran de Lodève), parts of which date from the sixth century. * Museum Fleury (temporary art exhibitions and archeology permanent collection). * L'Atelier national du tapis de Lodève, the French state carpet-making workshop. == Gallery == File:Lodeve Pont de Fer.jpg|The Pont de Fer ('Iron Bridge', 19th century), Lodève.
